refnamediv.refpurpose: A single line text entry field

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Implemented Interfaces
refsect1.para: GtkEntry implements AtkImplementorIface, GtkBuildable, GtkCellEditable and GtkEditable.

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "activates-default" gboolean : Read / Write "caps-lock-warning" gboolean : Read / Write "cursor-position" gint : Read "editable" gboolean : Read / Write "has-frame" gboolean : Read / Write "im-module" gchar* : Read / Write "inner-border" GtkBorder* : Read / Write "invisible-char" guint : Read / Write "invisible-char-set" gboolean : Read / Write "max-length" gint : Read / Write "overwrite-mode" gboolean : Read / Write "primary-icon-activatable" gboolean : Read / Write "primary-icon-gicon" GIcon* : Read / Write "primary-icon-name" gchar* : Read / Write "primary-icon-pixbuf" GdkPixbuf* : Read / Write "primary-icon-sensitive" gboolean : Read / Write "primary-icon-stock" gchar* : Read / Write "primary-icon-storage-type" GtkImageType : Read "primary-icon-tooltip-markup" gchar* : Read / Write "primary-icon-tooltip-text" gchar* : Read / Write "progress-fraction" gdouble : Read / Write "progress-pulse-step" gdouble : Read / Write "scroll-offset" gint : Read "secondary-icon-activatable" gboolean : Read / Write "secondary-icon-gicon" GIcon* : Read / Write "secondary-icon-name" gchar* : Read / Write "secondary-icon-pixbuf" GdkPixbuf* : Read / Write "secondary-icon-sensitive" gboolean : Read / Write "secondary-icon-stock" gchar* : Read / Write "secondary-icon-storage-type" GtkImageType : Read "secondary-icon-tooltip-markup" gchar* : Read / Write "secondary-icon-tooltip-text" gchar* : Read / Write "selection-bound" gint : Read "shadow-type" GtkShadowType : Read / Write "text" gchar* : Read / Write "text-length" guint : Read "truncate-multiline" gboolean : Read / Write "visibility" gboolean : Read / Write "width-chars" gint : Read / Write "xalign" gfloat : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Style Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "icon-prelight" gboolean : Read "inner-border" GtkBorder* : Read "invisible-char" guint : Read "progress-border" GtkBorder* : Read "state-hint" gboolean : Read

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "activate" : Run Last / Action "backspace" : Run Last / Action "copy-clipboard" : Run Last / Action "cut-clipboard" : Run Last / Action "delete-from-cursor" : Run Last / Action "icon-press" : Run Last "icon-release" : Run Last "insert-at-cursor" : Run Last / Action "move-cursor" : Run Last / Action "paste-clipboard" : Run Last / Action "populate-popup" : Run Last "toggle-overwrite" : Run Last / Action

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The GtkEntry widget is a single line text entry widget. A fairly large set of key bindings are supported by default. If the entered text is longer than the allocation of the widget, the widget will scroll so that the cursor position is visible.

When using an entry for passwords and other sensitive information, it can be put into "password mode" using gtk_entry_set_visibility(). In this mode, entered text is displayed using a 'invisible' character. By default, GTK+ picks the best invisible character that is available in the current font, but it can be changed with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char(). Since 2.16, GTK+ displays a warning when Caps Lock or input methods might interfere with entering text in a password entry. The warning can be turned off with the "caps-lock-warning" property.

Since 2.16, GtkEntry has the ability to display progress or activity information behind the text. To make an entry display such information, use gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction() or gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step().

Additionally, GtkEntry can show icons at either side of the entry. These icons can be activatable by clicking, can be set up as drag source and can have tooltips. To add an icon, use gtk_entry_set_icon_from_gicon() or one of the various other functions that set an icon from a stock id, an icon name or a pixbuf. To trigger an action when the user clicks an icon, connect to the "icon-press" signal. To allow DND operations from an icon, use gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source(). To set a tooltip on an icon, use gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text() or the corresponding function for markup.

Note that functionality or information that is only available by clicking on an icon in an entry may not be accessible at all to users which are not able to use a mouse or other pointing device. It is therefore recommended that any such functionality should also be available by other means, e.g. via the context menu of the entry.

refsect2.title: GtkEntry
refsect2.para: The GtkEntry struct contains only private data.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new entry.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_new_with_max_length ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_new_with_max_length is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_entry_set_max_length() instead.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkEntry widget with the given maximum length.

listitem.simpara: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets the text in the widget to the given value, replacing the current contents.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_append_text ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_append_text has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_editable_insert_text() instead.

refsect2.para: Appends the given text to the contents of the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_prepend_text ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_prepend_text has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_editable_insert_text() instead.

refsect2.para: Prepends the given text to the contents of the widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_position ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_set_position has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_editable_set_position() instead.

refsect2.para: Sets the cursor position in an entry to the given value.

listitem.simpara: the position of the cursor. The cursor is displayed before the character with the given (base 0) index in the widget. The value must be less than or equal to the number of characters in the widget. A value of -1 indicates that the position should be set after the last character in the entry. Note that this position is in characters, not in bytes.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_text ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the contents of the entry widget. See also gtk_editable_get_chars().

listitem.simpara: a pointer to the contents of the widget as a string. This string points to internally allocated storage in the widget and must not be freed, modified or stored.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_text_length ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the current length of the text in entry.

listitem.simpara: the current number of characters in GtkEntry, or 0 if there are none.

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_select_region ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_select_region has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_editable_select_region() instead.

refsect2.para: Selects a region of text. The characters that are selected are those characters at positions from start_pos up to, but not including end_pos. If end_pos is negative, then the the characters selected will be those characters from start_pos to the end of the text.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the contents of the entry are visible or not. When visibility is set to FALSE, characters are displayed as the invisible char, and will also appear that way when the text in the entry widget is copied elsewhere.
By default, GTK+ picks the best invisible character available in the current font, but it can be changed with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the contents of the entry are displayed as plaintext

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_invisible_char ()
refsect2.para: Sets the character to use in place of the actual text when gtk_entry_set_visibility() has been called to set text visibility to FALSE. i.e. this is the character used in "password mode" to show the user how many characters have been typed. By default, GTK+ picks the best invisible char available in the current font. If you set the invisible char to 0, then the user will get no feedback at all; there will be no text on the screen as they type.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_unset_invisible_char ()
refsect2.para: Unsets the invisible char previously set with gtk_entry_set_invisible_char(). So that the default invisible char is used again.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_editable ()

warning.para: gtk_entry_set_editable has been deprecated since version 2.0 and should not be used in newly-written code. Use gtk_editable_set_editable() instead.

refsect2.para: Determines if the user can edit the text in the editable widget or not.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the user is allowed to edit the text in the widget

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_max_length ()
refsect2.para: Sets the maximum allowed length of the contents of the widget. If the current contents are longer than the given length, then they will be truncated to fit.

listitem.simpara: the maximum length of the entry, or 0 for no maximum. (other than the maximum length of entries.) The value passed in will be clamped to the range 0-65536.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_activates_default ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the value set by gtk_entry_set_activates_default().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the entry will activate the default widget

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_has_frame ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_has_frame().

listitem.simpara: whether the entry has a beveled frame

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_inner_border ()
refsect2.para: This function returns the entry's "inner-border" property. See gtk_entry_set_inner_border() for more information.

listitem.simpara: the entry's GtkBorder, or NULL if none was set.

refsect2.para: Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_width_chars ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_width_chars().

listitem.simpara: number of chars to request space for, or negative if unset

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_activates_default ()
refsect2.para: If setting is TRUE, pressing Enter in the entry will activate the default widget for the window containing the entry. This usually means that the dialog box containing the entry will be closed, since the default widget is usually one of the dialog buttons.
(For experts: if setting is TRUE, the entry calls gtk_window_activate_default() on the window containing the entry, in the default handler for the "activate" signal.)

listitem.simpara: TRUE to activate window's default widget on Enter keypress

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_has_frame ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the entry has a beveled frame around it.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_inner_border ()
refsect2.para: Sets entry's inner-border property to border, or clears it if NULL is passed. The inner-border is the area around the entry's text, but inside its frame.

If set, this property overrides the inner-border style property. Overriding the style-provided border is useful when you want to do in-place editing of some text in a canvas or list widget, where pixel-exact positioning of the entry is important.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_width_chars ()
refsect2.para: Changes the size request of the entry to be about the right size for n_chars characters. Note that it changes the size request, the size can still be affected by how you pack the widget into containers. If n_chars is -1, the size reverts to the default entry size.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_invisible_char ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the character displayed in place of the real characters for entries with visibility set to false. See gtk_entry_set_invisible_char().

listitem.simpara: the current invisible char, or 0, if the entry does not show invisible text at all.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Sets the alignment for the contents of the entry. This controls the horizontal positioning of the contents when the displayed text is shorter than the width of the entry.

listitem.simpara: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_alignment ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_alignment().
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the text is overwritten when typing in the GtkEntry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_overwrite_mode ()
refsect2.para: Gets the value set by gtk_entry_set_overwrite_mode().

listitem.simpara: whether the text is overwritten when typing.

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_layout ()
refsect2.para: Gets the PangoLayout used to display the entry. The layout is useful to e.g. convert text positions to pixel positions, in combination with gtk_entry_get_layout_offsets(). The returned layout is owned by the entry and must not be modified or freed by the caller.

Keep in mind that the layout text may contain a preedit string, so gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index() and gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index() are needed to convert byte indices in the layout to byte indices in the entry contents.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_layout_offsets ()
refsect2.para: Obtains the position of the PangoLayout used to render text in the entry, in widget coordinates. Useful if you want to line up the text in an entry with some other text, e.g. when using the entry to implement editable cells in a sheet widget.
Also useful to convert mouse events into coordinates inside the PangoLayout, e.g. to take some action if some part of the entry text is clicked.

Note that as the user scrolls around in the entry the offsets will change; you'll need to connect to the "notify::scroll-offset" signal to track this. Remember when using the PangoLayout functions you need to convert to and from pixels using PANGO_PIXELS() or PANGO_SCALE.

Keep in mind that the layout text may contain a preedit string, so gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index() and gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index() are needed to convert byte indices in the layout to byte indices in the entry contents.

listitem.simpara: location to store X offset of layout, or NULL
location to store Y offset of layout, or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_layout_index_to_text_index ()
refsect2.para: Converts from a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()) to a position in the entry's PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout(), with text retrieved via pango_layout_get_text()).

listitem.simpara: byte index into the entry layout text
byte index into the entry contents

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_text_index_to_layout_index ()
refsect2.para: Converts from a position in the entry's PangoLayout (returned by gtk_entry_get_layout()) to a position in the entry contents (returned by gtk_entry_get_text()).

listitem.simpara: byte index into the entry contents
byte index into the entry layout text

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_max_length ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the maximum allowed length of the text in entry. See gtk_entry_set_max_length().

listitem.simpara: the maximum allowed number of characters in GtkEntry, or 0 if there is no maximum.

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_visibility ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves whether the text in entry is visible. See gtk_entry_set_visibility().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the text is currently visible

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_completion ()
refsect2.para: Sets completion to be the auxiliary completion object to use with entry. All further configuration of the completion mechanism is done on completion using the GtkEntryCompletion API. Completion is disabled if completion is set to NULL.
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_completion ()
refsect2.para: Returns the auxiliary completion object currently in use by entry.

listitem.simpara: The auxiliary completion object currently in use by entry.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_cursor_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Hooks up an adjustment to the cursor position in an entry, so that when the cursor is moved, the adjustment is scrolled to show that position. See gtk_scrolled_window_get_hadjustment() for a typical way of obtaining the adjustment.
The adjustment has to be in pixel units and in the same coordinate system as the entry.

listitem.simpara: an adjustment which should be adjusted when the cursor is moved, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_cursor_hadjustment ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the horizontal cursor adjustment for the entry. See gtk_entry_set_cursor_hadjustment().

listitem.simpara: the horizontal cursor adjustment, or NULL if none has been set.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction ()
refsect2.para: Causes the entry's progress indicator to "fill in" the given fraction of the bar. The fraction should be between 0.0 and 1.0, inclusive.

listitem.simpara: fraction of the task that's been completed

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_progress_fraction ()
refsect2.para: Returns the current fraction of the task that's been completed. See gtk_entry_set_progress_fraction().
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step ()
refsect2.para: Sets the fraction of total entry width to move the progress bouncing block for each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse().
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_progress_pulse_step ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the pulse step set with gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step().
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_progress_pulse ()
refsect2.para: Indicates that some progress is made, but you don't know how much. Causes the entry's progress indicator to enter "activity mode," where a block bounces back and forth. Each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse() causes the block to move by a little bit (the amount of movement per pulse is determined by gtk_entry_set_progress_pulse_step()).
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: enum GtkEntryIconPosition
refsect2.para: Specifies the side of the entry at which an icon is placed.

listitem.simpara: At the beginning of the entry (depending on the text direction).
At the end of the entry (depending on the text direction).

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_pixbuf ()
refsect2.para: Sets the icon shown in the specified position using a pixbuf.
If pixbuf is NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_stock ()
refsect2.para: Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from a stock image.
If stock_id is NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

listitem.simpara: The name of the stock item, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_icon_name ()
refsect2.para: Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme.
If the icon name isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead.
If icon_name is NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

listitem.simpara: The position at which to set the icon

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_from_gicon ()
refsect2.para: Sets the icon shown in the entry at the specified position from the current icon theme. If the icon isn't known, a "broken image" icon will be displayed instead.
If icon is NULL, no icon will be shown in the specified position.

listitem.simpara: The position at which to set the icon
The icon to set, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_storage_type ()
refsect2.para: Gets the type of representation being used by the icon to store image data. If the icon has no image data, the return value will be GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_pixbuf ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the image used for the icon.
Unlike the other methods of setting and getting icon data, this method will work regardless of whether the icon was set using a GdkPixbuf, a GIcon, a stock item, or an icon name.

listitem.simpara: A GdkPixbuf, or NULL if no icon is set for this position.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_stock ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the stock id used for the icon, or NULL if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by pixbuf, icon name or gicon).

listitem.simpara: A stock id, or NULL if no icon is set or if the icon wasn't set from a stock id

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_name ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the icon name used for the icon, or NULL if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by pixbuf, stock or gicon).

listitem.simpara: An icon name, or NULL if no icon is set or if the icon wasn't set from an icon name

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_gicon ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the GIcon used for the icon, or NULL if there is no icon or if the icon was set by some other method (e.g., by stock, pixbuf, or icon name).

listitem.simpara: A GIcon, or NULL if no icon is set or if the icon is not a GIcon

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_activatable ()
refsect2.para: Sets whether the icon is activatable.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the icon should be activatable

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_activatable ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the icon is activatable.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the icon is activatable.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Sets the sensitivity for the specified icon.

listitem.simpara: Specifies whether the icon should appear sensitive or insensitive

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_sensitive ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the icon appears sensitive or insensitive.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the icon is sensitive.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_at_pos ()
refsect2.para: Finds the icon at the given position and return its index. If x, y doesn't lie inside an icon, -1 is returned. This function is intended for use in a "query-tooltip" signal handler.

listitem.simpara: the x coordinate of the position to find
the y coordinate of the position to find
the index of the icon at the given position, or -1

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Sets tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position.
Use NULL for tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_text() and gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup().

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_text ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in entry.

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. Free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Sets tooltip as the contents of the tooltip for the icon at the specified position. tooltip is assumed to be marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Use NULL for tooltip to remove an existing tooltip.
See also gtk_widget_set_tooltip_markup() and gtk_enty_set_icon_tooltip_text().

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for the icon, or NULL

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_icon_tooltip_markup ()
refsect2.para: Gets the contents of the tooltip on the icon at the specified position in entry.

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or NULL. Free the returned string with g_free() when done.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_entry_set_icon_drag_source (GtkEntry *entry, GtkEntryIconPosition icon_pos, GtkTargetList *target_list, GdkDragAction actions);
refsect2.para: Sets up the icon at the given position so that GTK+ will start a drag operation when the user clicks and drags the icon.

To handle the drag operation, you need to connect to the usual "drag-data-get" (or possibly "drag-data-delete") signal, and use gtk_entry_get_current_icon_drag_source() in your signal handler to find out if the drag was started from an icon.

By default, GTK+ uses the icon as the drag icon. You can use the "drag-begin" signal to set a different icon. Note that you have to use g_signal_connect_after() to ensure that your signal handler gets executed after the default handler.

listitem.simpara: the targets (data formats) in which the data can be provided
a bitmask of the allowed drag actions

refsect2.title: gtk_entry_get_current_icon_drag_source ()
refsect2.para: Returns the index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.
This function is meant to be used in a "drag-data-get" callback.

listitem.simpara: index of the icon which is the source of the current DND operation, or -1.

refsect2.title: The "activates-default" property
refsect2.para: Whether to activate the default widget (such as the default button in a dialog) when Enter is pressed.
Default value: FALSE

refsect2.title: The "caps-lock-warning" property
refsect2.para: Whether password entries will show a warning when Caps Lock is on.
Note that the warning is shown using a secondary icon, and thus does not work if you are using the secondary icon position for some other purpose.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "cursor-position" property
refsect2.para: The current position of the insertion cursor in chars.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "editable" property
refsect2.para: Whether the entry contents can be edited.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "has-frame" property
refsect2.para: FALSE removes outside bevel from entry.
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "im-module" property
refsect2.para: Which IM (input method) module should be used for this entry. See GtkIMContext.
Setting this to a non-NULL value overrides the system-wide IM module setting. See the GtkSettings "gtk-im-module" property.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "inner-border" property
refsect2.para: Sets the text area's border between the text and the frame.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "invisible-char" property
refsect2.para: The character to use when masking entry contents (in "password mode").
Default value: '*'

refsect2.title: The "invisible-char-set" property
refsect2.para: Whether the invisible char has been set for the GtkEntry.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "max-length" property
refsect2.para: Maximum number of characters for this entry. Zero if no maximum.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "overwrite-mode" property
refsect2.para: If text is overwritten when typing in the GtkEntry.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-activatable" property
refsect2.para: Whether the primary icon is activatable.
GTK+ emits the "icon-press" and "icon-release" signals only on sensitive, activatable icons.
Sensitive, but non-activatable icons can be used for purely informational purposes.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-gicon" property
refsect2.para: The GIcon to use for the primary icon for the entry.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The icon name to use for the primary icon for the entry.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-pixbuf" property
refsect2.para: A pixbuf to use as the primary icon for the entry.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-sensitive" property
refsect2.para: Whether the primary icon is sensitive.
An insensitive icon appears grayed out. GTK+ does not emit the "icon-press" and "icon-release" signals and does not allow DND from insensitive icons.
An icon should be set insensitive if the action that would trigger when clicked is currently not available.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-stock" property
refsect2.para: The stock id to use for the primary icon for the entry.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-storage-type" property
refsect2.para: The representation which is used for the primary icon of the entry.
Default value: GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-tooltip-markup" property
refsect2.para: The contents of the tooltip on the primary icon, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Also see gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup().
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "primary-icon-tooltip-text" property
refsect2.para: The contents of the tooltip on the primary icon.
Also see gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text().
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "progress-fraction" property
refsect2.para: The current fraction of the task that's been completed.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "progress-pulse-step" property
refsect2.para: The fraction of total entry width to move the progress bouncing block for each call to gtk_entry_progress_pulse().
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0.1
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "scroll-offset" property
refsect2.para: Number of pixels of the entry scrolled off the screen to the left.
Allowed values: >= 0
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-activatable" property
refsect2.para: Whether the secondary icon is activatable.
GTK+ emits the "icon-press" and "icon-release" signals only on sensitive, activatable icons.
Sensitive, but non-activatable icons can be used for purely informational purposes.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-gicon" property
refsect2.para: The GIcon to use for the secondary icon for the entry.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-name" property
refsect2.para: The icon name to use for the secondary icon for the entry.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-pixbuf" property
refsect2.para: An pixbuf to use as the secondary icon for the entry.
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-sensitive" property
refsect2.para: Whether the secondary icon is sensitive.
An insensitive icon appears grayed out. GTK+ does not emit the "icon-press" and "icon-release" signals and does not allow DND from insensitive icons.
An icon should be set insensitive if the action that would trigger when clicked is currently not available.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-stock" property
refsect2.para: The stock id to use for the secondary icon for the entry.
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-storage-type" property
refsect2.para: The representation which is used for the secondary icon of the entry.
Default value: GTK_IMAGE_EMPTY
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-tooltip-markup" property
refsect2.para: The contents of the tooltip on the secondary icon, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language.
Also see gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_markup().
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "secondary-icon-tooltip-text" property
refsect2.para: The contents of the tooltip on the secondary icon.
Also see gtk_entry_set_icon_tooltip_text().
Default value: NULL
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "selection-bound" property
refsect2.para: The position of the opposite end of the selection from the cursor in chars.
Allowed values: [0,65535]
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "shadow-type" property
refsect2.para: Which kind of shadow to draw around the entry when "has-frame" is set to TRUE.
Default value: GTK_SHADOW_IN
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: The "text" property
refsect2.para: The contents of the entry.
Default value: ""

refsect2.title: The "text-length" property
refsect2.para: The length of the text in the GtkEntry.
Allowed values: <= 65535
Default value: 0
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: The "truncate-multiline" property
refsect2.para: When TRUE, pasted multi-line text is truncated to the first line.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "visibility" property
refsect2.para: FALSE displays the "invisible char" instead of the actual text (password mode).
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "width-chars" property
refsect2.para: Number of characters to leave space for in the entry.
Allowed values: >= G_MAXULONG
Default value: -1

refsect2.title: The "xalign" property
refsect2.para: The horizontal alignment, from 0 (left) to 1 (right). Reversed for RTL layouts.
Allowed values: [0,1]
Default value: 0
Since 2.4

refsect2.title: The "icon-prelight" style property
refsect2.para: The prelight style property determines whether activatable icons prelight on mouseover.
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "inner-border" style property
refsect2.para: Sets the text area's border between the text and the frame.
Since 2.10

refsect2.title: The "invisible-char" style property
refsect2.para: The character to use when masking entry contents (in "password mode").
Default value: 0

refsect2.title: The "progress-border" style property
refsect2.para: Border around the progress bar.

refsect2.title: The "state-hint" style property
refsect2.para: Indicates whether to pass a proper widget state when drawing the shadow and the widget background.
Default value: FALSE
Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "activate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: A keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user activates the entry.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control activation programmatically.
The default bindings for this signal are all forms of the Enter key.

listitem.simpara: The entry on which the signal is emitted
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "backspace" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::backspace signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user asks for it.
The default bindings for this signal are Backspace and Shift-Backspace.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "copy-clipboard" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::copy-clipboard signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to copy the selection to the clipboard.
The default bindings for this signal are Ctrl-c and Ctrl-Insert.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "cut-clipboard" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::cut-clipboard signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to cut the selection to the clipboard.
The default bindings for this signal are Ctrl-x and Shift-Delete.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "delete-from-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, GtkDeleteType type, gint count, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::delete-from-cursor signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user initiates a text deletion.
If the type is GTK_DELETE_CHARS, GTK+ deletes the selection if there is one, otherwise it deletes the requested number of characters.
The default bindings for this signal are Delete for deleting a character and Ctrl-Delete for deleting a word.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the granularity of the deletion, as a GtkDeleteType
the number of type units to delete
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "icon-press" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, GtkEntryIconPosition icon_pos, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::icon-press signal is emitted when an activatable icon is clicked.

listitem.simpara: The entry on which the signal is emitted
The position of the clicked icon
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "icon-release" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, GtkEntryIconPosition icon_pos, GdkEvent *event, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::icon-release signal is emitted on the button release from a mouse click over an activatable icon.

listitem.simpara: The entry on which the signal is emitted
The position of the clicked icon
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.para: Since 2.16

refsect2.title: The "insert-at-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gchar *string, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::insert-at-cursor signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user initiates the insertion of a fixed string at the cursor.
This signal has no default bindings.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-cursor" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, GtkMovementStep step, gint count, gboolean extend_selection, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::move-cursor signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted when the user initiates a cursor movement. If the cursor is not visible in entry, this signal causes the viewport to be moved instead.
Applications should not connect to it, but may emit it with g_signal_emit_by_name() if they need to control the cursor programmatically.

The default bindings for this signal come in two variants, the variant with the Shift modifier extends the selection, the variant without the Shift modifer does not. There are too many key combinations to list them all here.
Arrow keys move by individual characters/lines Ctrl-arrow key combinations move by words/paragraphs Home/End keys move to the ends of the buffer

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the granularity of the move, as a GtkMovementStep
the number of step units to move
TRUE if the move should extend the selection
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "paste-clipboard" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::paste-clipboard signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to paste the contents of the clipboard into the text view.
The default bindings for this signal are Ctrl-v and Shift-Insert.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "populate-popup" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, GtkMenu *menu, gpointer user_data) : Run Last
refsect2.para: The ::populate-popup signal gets emitted before showing the context menu of the entry.
If you need to add items to the context menu, connect to this signal and append your menuitems to the menu.

listitem.simpara: The entry on which the signal is emitted
the menu that is being populated
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "toggle-overwrite" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkEntry *entry, gpointer user_data) : Run Last / Action
refsect2.para: The ::toggle-overwrite signal is a keybinding signal which gets emitted to toggle the overwrite mode of the entry.
The default bindings for this signal is Insert.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

listitem.para: a widget for handling multi-line text entry.
